intro: Podocarpus lambertii var. transiens, commonly known as the Transient Podocarpus, is a rare evergreen shrub or small tree native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Podocarpaceae family, characterized by its conifer-like appearance and needle-like leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Its foliage is dense and dark green, providing ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
